result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF178, 13CT42, 13CM681, 13CM104 and 15FO80:
  CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Richard Louis Yonko   DF:  Cory Steven Stanhope appeared. Case called at 10:20 a.m. ADA McKinley states there is a global resolution. Recites agreement. State has complied with victims rights. Atty Yonko is in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. 15CF178 DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1. 13CM681 DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 2. 13CM104 DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 1 and 2. 13CT42 DE pleads guilty to amended Ct. 1, 343.18 (1) Failure to carry dl.   DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct's 1 and 2 in 13CM104. Finds DE guilty to amended Ct. 1 in 13CT42, 343.18 (1) Failure to Carry DL.  Finds DE guilty of Ct.1 in 15CF178. In file 15CF178, Ct. 1 court will withhold plea per deferred agreement.   AODA and follow any recommended treatment. 

On motion of the State, 13CM681 Crt dismisses and reads in Ct's 1 and 3 for sentencing purposes. 13CT42 Ct dismisses and read in Ct.2 for sentencing purposes. 15CF178 Ct's 2,3 and 4 are dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. Dismiss 15FO80. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. Court will approve the deffered agreement and will sign today.

Crt orders:

On 13CM104 and 13CM681:

- S/W 2 years probation on each count concurrent. Defendant to report to probation no later than 3 p.m. today. Bond will continue until defendant signs up for probation.

- Obtain a valid DL

- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, BP in Star Prairie.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Restitution in the amount of $40.00 to be paid to BP

- $500 fine x 3 inclusive of costs. Pay over the course of probation.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

13CM681- 20 days jail as a condition of probation. If defendant gains employment, court would consider granting Huber. Must report to jail within 30 days of today's date. Regarding jail credit, parties are given 30 days to file recommendations with the court. 

13CT42- $150.10 fine. Pay to Clerk of Court. Set up payment plan

Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  BP Gas Station in Star Prairie.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: CAR, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Cory Steven Stanhope appeared from jail. Includes 15CF178 & 15FO80.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
